result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamartre A Walton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $5,817.00 payable to Landmark Crdit Union as to the dismissed and read in case 14CF217.

Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.
AS TO RESITUTION AND ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program if deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victims or coactors.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing JULY 24, 2015 received and filed. kl
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; filed.
(3) Defendant's Character Witness Letters; filed.
Defendant's Letter of Apology; filed.

Defendant Lamartre A Walton in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 12 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 6 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS.
Credit given for 570 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):  
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with the co-actors.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitutuion in the amount of $5,817.00 payable to Landmark Credit union as to the dismissed and read-in case# 14CF217.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Restitution Worksheet.
Copy of State's Written Offer.

Defendant Lamartre A Walton in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
Defendant's Character Witness Letter; filed.

Defendant Lamartre A Walton in court with attorney Jon A La Mendola.  Defendant Lamartre A Walton in custody.  Tyrone St. Junior for Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
